doc.title: Forgotten Crossroads
doc.plot: An orphaned journalist wants to write a book about the father he never knew and hitchhikes to the railway station of an old deserted village that was destroyed during WWII. He has only two memories from his childhood: his father went to Africa and his mother, a beautiful woman like Ingrid Bergman, died when the he was six years old. Then, strange things happen at the station... The journalist is thrown back into time and finds himself at a small and charming railway station. Bombs are exploding and everywhere there is sabotage and conspiracies. Suddenly the journalist recognizes his father, an 8-year-old boy who is trying to steal a forbidden Casablanca-poster. As he tries to speak to his father; German soldiers arrive and separate them. Will the journalist have time to discover the truth about his parents? A melodramatic fantasy follows...
